page.title: 03WOLD NEWTON VILLAGE (CONT)
page.content: The village is clustered around the village pond and village green. These occupy the site of a former piece of common land which was always damp and marshy. To celebrate the Queen's Jubilee in 1977 the villagers tidied the area and constructed a new pond. The overflow from this pond feeds into a natural pond known as The Mere which in turn feeds the Gypsey Race. Like the Gypsey Race this pond appears and disappears according to the water level in the underground reservoirs. The main facilities are directly adjacent to the green - "The Anvil Arms"(the village pub),telephone kiosk,shop,post office and bus stop. The village school,the cricket field and the football field are all nearby.
